hackathon-description-text: will be happening January 28th to 29th at McGill's
hackathon-eligibility:
If you applied to McHacks 17, 
Each team must consist of no more than 4 members.
hackathon-requirements:
You must include videos, photos, or screenshots of the working product and a link to the source code (GitHub, etc.) of your project.
Please tag the prizes you would like to be considered for (other than the overall prizes, every team that submits will be considered for overall prizes).

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Top 3 overall prizes of McHacks chosen for their originality, technical difficulty, practicality and enjoyment. Each member of the winning teams get to choose a preferred prize from the following list.
Best use the Lexalytics API - each member of the winning team will receive an Amazon gift card.
Best use of the Nuance API - Each member of the winning team receives an Apple watch.
Best CaPS student reflection app - each member of the winning team will receive $150 cash.
The best hack made by a first-time hackathon team (ALL freshies)
Best team which used no APIs in their project - each member of the winning team will receive an Etsy gift card.
For the team that best exemplifies "shit that no one needs"
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Useless Stuff that No-one Needs Prize

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: For the project that makes us feel the warmest and fuzziest inside.
For the team whose project drove them crazy
For the team whose project demonstrated best use of machine learning.
For the most badass American team
Team that best exemplifies Montreal's spirit. The team will receive an $100 giftcard to la Banquise.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=3600 Rue McTavish, Montréal, QC H3A 0G3, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is this hack something new? Is it a creative use of technology? Is it a novel idea?
Which technologies did you use? How technically challenging is it? Which part of the project did you make? (Non-API)
Is the hack fun to use? Is the interface polished? Is the user experience fun to use?
Is the hack useful? Does it raise social awareness or help under-privileged and under-represented people in any way?

hackathon-location-address: 3600 Rue McTavish, Montréal, QC H3A 0G3, Canada
